Snip

Snip is an add-on designed to ease the process of turning paper worksheets into Google Forms. It provides a convenient way to crop scanned worksheets and save the resulting images to Google Drive in an organized, logical way.

Click here to download a PDF containing screenshots and instructions for using Snip.

If you have just installed Snip and do not see the "Snip images" button when you open the Snip menu, refresh the page.

Click here to view Snipped images for this form in Drive

Instructions

  1. Click on the add-ons menu (puzzle piece icon in the upper right side of the Forms editor)
  2. Click "Snip"
  3. Click "Snip Images"
  4. Click "Select Image" and pick an existing image from your Drive or upload your own
  5. Drag the blue handles on the crop rectangle to select an instruction or question you would like to save as its own image.
    • Scroll up and down with your mouse/trackpad to zoom in and out on the image
    • Click and drag outside the crop box to move the worksheet around
    • Click and drag inside the crop box to move the crop box around
  6. Select whether the image is a set of instructions or a question/answer
    • If the image is a question/answer, specify the question number and whether it is an answer option for that question.
  7. Click "Save to Drive" and your image will automatically be cropped, named, and saved into a Google Drive folder unique to the open form.
  8. Crop and save as many images as you need. You can continue to crop and save as images are uploading; however, please wait for all images to finish saving before closing the Snip window.

Images are saved to a folder in your Google Drive and named based on their question number so that you can insert them into your forms. Click here to learn how to add images to questions and answers.

To take advantage of Snip, please completely install and enable the add-on.

Install the add-on:

  1. Click on the add-ons menu (puzzle piece icon in the upper right side of the Forms editor)
  2. Click "Snip"
  3. Click "Help"
  4. Click "View in Store"
  5. Install the add-on by clicking the "Free" button
  6. Choose the Google account you wish to connect to the add on
  7. Click "Allow" to allow the add-on to access your account. This is only used to upload from and save to your Google Drive.

If you have installed the add-on but can only access the instructions:

You may need to enable Snip for the current form.

  1. Click on the add-ons menu (puzzle piece icon in the upper right side of the Forms editor)
  2. Click "Snip"
  3. Click "Help"
  4. Click "View in Store"
  5. Click the green "Manage" button
  6. Click "Use in this document" if there is not a checkmark next to it
  7. Refresh the Google Forms page
  8. Reopen the "Snip" add-on menu and click "Snip Images" to begin Snipping
